website_summaries.verdict: An exceedingly popular kayak paddle recognized for its affordability and quality feel.
pros: Customers like this paddle better than even more expensive models for its sturdy and light construction
Blades are curved for better maneuvering
cons: Paddle does not float when wet

customer_reviews.title: Paddle Broke after 15 minutes of light use
customer_reviews.text: After 15 minutes of paddling in slow moving water, the paddle snapped in half (not in half where the pieces connect- but the bar itself snapped). It was not hit on anything- the bar simply could not handle light paddling. Thankfully we were close to the shore or we would have embodied the saying 'up a creek without a paddle' to the fullest! These felt cheap and poorly made but we decided to give them a shot....it was definitely a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: K & E

customer_reviews.title: Performance is great. I've read other reviews that show an "old" ...
customer_reviews.text: Price vs. Performance is great. I've read other reviews that show an "old" version and a "new" version. I received the "new" version. While they might be a tad flimsy on the end, for 30$ it's pretty light and does the job. I also used it to do some light pushing off the bottom. I'm not worried about it breaking. It pushed me and my 75lb kayak around the reservoir yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: Monotone Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle!
customer_reviews.text: I've been paddling for over 10 years and I own a number of good paddles. I bought this because I wanted a longer paddle for the open water, but after using it for the first time, it became my favorite. I have paddles that cost over $250 and I like this one better. It's sturdy enough to stand up to the rough treatment I demand and it's light enough that my arms don't get tired late in the day. It's also long and gives me more power and reach. It's not super rugged, but it's also not fragile. The best part is the price. I don't think you can get a better quality paddle for the price. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Papa52

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive description
customer_reviews.text: The description says that this paddle comes with a 3 position pin system. I erroneously assumed that this meant the manufacturer installed the mechanism whereby the 2 halves of the paddle locked into 3 different positions. Mine came with just holes, nothing locks, and the 2 halves move when paddling. I guess I'm supposed to provide my own pin. Wasted money on this oar. Lesson learned. UPDATE: Kudos to Amazon's replacement policy. Completed details online, next business day replacement oar was delivered only hours after defective product was given to UPS for return.
customer_reviews.author: HoneybeeGardener

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, largely based on customer reviews, because I wanted longer paddles than I had. Very pleased with these, especially at this price point; these seem to be as sturdy as the much more expensive paddles I bought with my kayaks. The length of these paddles eliminated "drips" back in to my boats and they are very comfortable to use. I was surprised to realize that I prefer paddles without the padded handles; these aren't uncomfortable or anything, I just prefer the lack of padding like my shorter paddles.....I'll probably remove the padding on these handles, but, either way they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: kat lowry

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and light, not the sturdiest paddle out there
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light compared to the cheap paddle I bought from Academy Sports for a similar price. I will say that it feels a little flimsy, but I'm not kayaking through rapids or big surf or anything, I am sticking to calm lakes and ponds. So I don't for see any issues. I'll sacrifice the flimsy-ness for a light paddle that doesn't cost a ton of $$. Oh, and the shaft is a little thinner than my last paddle and doesn't sit too well in my taco clip.
customer_reviews.author: JM76

customer_reviews.title: Super light weight but no strenght
customer_reviews.text: I liked it for the first 5 mins then i noticed it was bent i started paddling back t shore just before i reached shore it completely bent in half and I couldn't paddle with it I was shocked it was huge surf and luckily made it in safely but very dangerous situation,definitely would not recommend this paddle, I cant believe it has so many good reviews my guess is they never actually used it .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy- look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: On the second kayak trip this paddle broke. Very unhappy with the quality. We are recreational kayakers, gentle lakes, so nothing rough or rapid. It bent under the padding - took them apart and had to use it as a canoe paddle to get back to the dock.
customer_reviews.author: jlovek247

customer_reviews.title: Literally up the creek without a paddle
customer_reviews.text: As I write this, I am an hour and a half upstream with a broken paddle. This is only the second time I have used this paddle. While padding in 12 - 16 inches of water, the right blade caught the bottom, and snapped off at the pole. I am beyond pissed when I think about how bad my return trip will be. Don't waste your money on this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Mine is now shaped like a banana after a year of use. I have probably used it a dozen times over the last year and started bending about half way through and now is usable. I usually don't write a lot of reviews but when I have to spend more money to solve one problem it drive me nuts. This product is not made to last and I recommend spending your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sides

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle. I wouldn't get one less than this ...
customer_reviews.text: Good paddle. I wouldn't get one less than this length because the longer size really makes a huge difference in keeping water out of the kayak and off one's self from the water running down the paddle. The paddle that came with my kayak as shorter and it was terrible. This one works great and seems to be more efficient than the shorter one too. I don't even know why they sell those shorter ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this paddle
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this paddle. It is good and long. Since I'm 6' 3" tall, it is just the right size. The bar has two nicely padded areas for an easy grip. It is great for the casual flat water paddler, but probably not durable enough for whitewater paddlers or those that are rough on equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Kuhrt

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product for use in rugged outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: Good size for a backup with the 10' x 4' aluminum jon boat. Good length, has foam grips, good quality. Used the paddle to free a jug line from an obstacle about 7' down (not recommended or prohibited xD ). Only mod was after reading paddle might separate from shaft i used a 5/16 hex head screw 1" long on opposite side of paddle mount from rivet and little lower to miss rivet with screw. Works well have fun!
customer_reviews.author: OneBadTexan

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use!!
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was a great paddle when it arrived- but it literally snapped on the first use!! It must be made of the cheapest material possible. I bought this as a gift for my husband. By the time he used it it was past the return timeframe. So I was out of luck and of the cost for this (and now a replacement). I do not recommend that you waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: H Horton

customer_reviews.title: Snapped first time in use
customer_reviews.text: This paddle snapped the first time I used it. The actual paddle snapped in half exposing all the bubbles and cheap plastic used to manufacture this. The paddle portion is extremely flexible and at an exaggerated scoop angle. I was in open water on a lake for about two hours and "Snap". Do not buy this product,
customer_reviews.author: Hening

customer_reviews.title: Good Paddle for the Price
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I was a little skeptical of purchasing this after some of the negative reviews about how flimsy they are, but I have used them 5 times now in the river and they have worked great. I did not use them to push off from the shore, though. I don't believe they are sturdy enough to use in that fashion. To paddle, they work great. I have used them in calm waters as well as rapids and they functioned exactly as I would expect them to. Everyone else in our group has shorter paddles and they always want to use mine. I would recommend this paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Kris S.

customer_reviews.title: Shoreline Marine Kayak Paddle
customer_reviews.text: These are the lightest kayak paddles I've used, they're great in the water and have a nice comfortable feel to them. I reccomend these to 99% of people looking for a kayak paddle We've used them for almost a year and I've only found 2 faults to mention in them; the small metal detent to break them down is a type of steel and started to rust, loosing some of it's spring character, and when the foam get's soaked it likes to slip around the shaft. We've put some major abuse on these paddles and have yet to break them. Great Product at an awesome price. Unless you're into extreme white water kayaking these are the best deal around.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Highly discouraged for practical use
customer_reviews.text: This paddle broke the first time I used it. I was in a slow moving river and the shaft completely gave when met with minimal resistance. I would strongly discourage anyone using this paddle. When I first unboxed it my first reactions were "oh, this is quite flimsy." I wish I would have trusted my instinct. I ended up paddling an additional 9 miles with it as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk!  Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Used this one time. Next time I went to use it, the plastic of the paddle literally crumbled in my hand. Very very brittle. Had to throw it away. Terrible terrible product! Glad I wasn't far from shore when this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Great length and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: We got these paddels for two kayaks because they are longer. Just used them the other day and they are great. The splash guards are nice keeping water from getting on you, plus the length of the paddels make water harder to splash on you. They are light weight and easy to maneuver. The foam is thicker which is nice on the hands and keeps me from getting blisters on my hands. Taking them apart was easy with a push of a button. The length is great and makes it so much easier to paddel.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: but this paddle worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but this paddle worked like a charm! Pushed off with it several times, including off rocks. My dog bit it several times while, swimming beside my kayak. Like the curvature of the blades. The longer length enabled the blade to be completely submerged. Didn't cause any soreness in my hands. Paddle didn't seem overly heavy. Only complaint, grips don't stay in place. Will try electrical tape beneath them to maintain the proper position. Great starter paddle and cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Zon P

customer_reviews.title: Well designed shape and very strong.
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed paddles, little bit on the heavier side, but that was expected for this price range. It is really not much more expensive than many generic plastic and aluminum paddles for inflatables that will break in a day, this paddle serves much better in function and design, it is much stronger than all paddles in this price range, if weight isn't a big issue, and you just need paddles that work really well and want to use it for a long time, get this kit.
customer_reviews.author: I Love FL Shop

customer_reviews.title: Pure Chinese junk. Lasted 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Paddle lasted about 15 minutes. I’ve had several from cheap to expensive and this one folded in half on the first hard paddle I made to swing my bow in current. Pure Chinese junk. I wasted 45 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfortable. I thought I really liked it until only my 4th use. I was paddling without an excessive amount of force and it snapped. Not strong enough at all, I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: They're fantastic. Sure
customer_reviews.text: For as cheap as these were, I expected them to be just okay. They're fantastic. Sure, they're not ultra-light or anything, but they're made well enough for the weekend warrior. The foam kept my hands comfortable, the rubber grommets kept the water out of my lap, and the blades have a wave to them that seemed to offer some added stability to the paddle. One con to note: The blades are held on by a spring pin and one of mine is a bit loose. It doesn't affect usability (yet) but it could lead to problems moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: DR Rizzles

customer_reviews.title: As a purely recreation paddle it would be great, easy paddling and just having fun
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of rigorous, hard paddling, cutting and changing directions. This paddle didn't perform as well as the one I have been using. It doesn't have the 'bite' that my old paddle does. Also it doesn't have the flattened right end that allows me to know how the paddle is oriented in my hands, without looking. As a purely recreation paddle it would be great, easy paddling and just having fun. I do like the foam grips, they are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Claude

customer_reviews.title: Shoreline Marine Kayak Paddle
customer_reviews.text: These paddles are well made, aluminum shaft, standard locking tabs, filled with something so they float, foam grips, large drip rings, plastic blades. Not your top of the line paddles but an economical paddle. Good enough for me to paddle around the lake. The blades have a funny curve and re-curve to them. I am still getting used to that. I found that if I sweep them too far back behind me they tend to stick in the water, I feel resistance when I pull them out for the next stroke. I learned to only stroke them to beside me when I pull them out of the water. I read that is the proper way to paddle.
customer_reviews.author: eMikey0

customer_reviews.title: Paddle blades can only withstand light use
customer_reviews.text: Grips, adjustable handle, and drip guards are nice and work well, but the paddle blades weak. I snapped one of these blades the first time I used it by pushing through a sand bar. In my many years of paddling, this is the first paddle blade I had ever broken....disappointing. If you paddle hard or use your paddles to push through drag areas I would recommend a paddle with different, beefier blades.
customer_reviews.author: CJF

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on an 11 mile paddle in a small river. The paddle was extremely difficult due to excessive duck weed. At some points I had to use the paddle as a pole vaulter's pole and it never broke. I definitely did not baby the thing either. The pole is metal but much lighter than my old paddle so it's an upgrade for me. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: gergs

customer_reviews.title: Quality—- I’m skeptical
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but I have to agree with other reviews regarding the quality. It feels flimsy. Time will tell but I would not have purchased the paddle had I felt it in a store
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Thought the product was great at first
customer_reviews.text: Thought the product was great at first, but if you're a guy with good force, the paddles are too flimsy and will give to the water. As in, as you're rowing, the paddle will bend. Additionally, it is not rigid enough to reliable propel yourself if you're in a shallow area and need to push off the floro or some rocks. Would not buy it again. Thought about returning it, but since it was so cheap, cost of shipping would be too much.
customer_reviews.author: SacTu

customer_reviews.title: The 8 ft paddles are a perfect length. I first purchased paddles at a sporting ...
customer_reviews.text: The 8 ft paddles are a perfect length. I first purchased paddles at a sporting good store with the intent in finding the longest ones I could find at a price point of $50. That paddle was just too short. I unpacked these and noticed that the aluminum shaft diameter was smaller then the store bought ones but they did have additional foam around the hand grip locations. I tried them out and was extremely happy with the length and the paddles appeared to plow through the water with ease. The smaller pole diameter did not have any negative affect or extra bowing. You cannot go wrong buying these for any application. Great price point as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Too Weak!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday, while paddling around with my son, the oar bent and snapped! And in case you were wondering, I'm 52 with a screwed-up right elbow, so you can imagine how little pressure I was putting on it. The thing bent in the middle, broke in half, so I gave one half to the kid and we paddled back to shore. Total piece of junk. -
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W.

customer_reviews.title: PLEASED!
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. Not too heavy. I kayak calm waters (like inlet lakes and non rapids rivers) and I am not sure if the tip of this paddle would be any good for those who would have to use the paddle to push off rocks or other surfaces in a tight spot. Seems to me like it might snap if you do. But for the areas I go it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mammykay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value if you need a 240cm paddle
customer_reviews.text: Being a longer paddle this works exactly as intended. Assembles and reassembles easily with the spring loaded pin locks, but won't fall apart when you use it. A hair over 240cm, works well for inflatable kayaks and wider kayaks needing a reach. $35 bucks, can't beat it for value. Compared to $100+ paddles that do pretty much the same thing. Unless you are a hardcore kayaking fanatic you can't beat this paddle. And if you are a kayaking fanatic or slalom pro, what are you doing looking at $35 paddles anyway?
customer_reviews.author: ChrisF

customer_reviews.title: Are there better paddles out there
customer_reviews.text: Solid paddle.It has stood up to many hours on the lake and rivers. Drip guards keep me and the boat dry and it snaps and adjusts with ease. Are there better paddles out there? Sure but you're going to pay a lot more and really not see that much of a difference. A solid paddle is crucial when out in the middle of a lake or down stream on a river and I put my trust in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeMaeyer

customer_reviews.title: Longer than recommended but LOVE this paddle
customer_reviews.text: Longer than recommended but LOVE this paddle. Hubby loved it also so I ordered him one as well. Really cuts down on water dripping on us while paddling, easily propels our 10 footers effortlessly, light weight and fits yak clips perfectly. (Something other paddles don't do well)
customer_reviews.author: Farrah

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful paddle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paddle because of a new purchase of a kayak. With all the paddles out there I didn't know where to start. A friend of mine recommended this one. He's had his over a year and been on multiple outings with it. Its held up great with six trips so far. If it broke I would assume it's my error. It has performed past my expectations for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Southern handyman

customer_reviews.title: Light, forceful, portable
customer_reviews.text: My first kayak paddle. Seems light compared to some I held in the store. Adjustable head angle so paddles can be lined up or crossed. Efficiently channels water due to head shape. Splitting it into two pieces is very convenient, fits in my kayak no problem. Only drawback I've noticed after about 30 hours of total use is that the paddle takes on water. Somewhere inside of it is a space that allows water to gather, and it can't just be shaken out. It slowly drips out when placed with the heads facing up. Great first paddle!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: The 1st time I used it on the river the shaft bent and then it snapped off near the oar. I had to have my oars (paddles) put onto a new shaft. I was 45mins from my car on the water, literally up river without a paddle.
customer_reviews.author: April Love

customer_reviews.title: Probably okay for lake use, but not for rivers
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of this paddle is good, there is no real problem with it in terms of how its made. The only problem I encountered is that the paddle surfaces themselves are not very rigid, so there is a lot of bend to them when cutting through the water. This, of course, makes every stroke less efficient, and requires more effort. When in fast-moving water and trying to avoid the rocks, this can be a challenge. I will be keeping this paddle as a back-up, but plan to purchase a new one with stiffer paddle surfaces to use as my primary.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: very happy with my paddle
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. I can understand the other reviews saying the paddle is weak and flimsy. The connection point is maybe only 2". Wish it was a little deeper. However as a first time kayaker I am very happy with it. My last paddle (came with the kayak) was about 70cm shorter then what is recommended for my size and the kayak size. Paddled up wind in 20mpr gusts and did fine!!!
customer_reviews.author: star grace

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The paddles are great price for this quality. The picture doesn't do it justice. I went to several sporting goods store before ordering this one. My husband is tall and with long arms, the regular paddles were too short. The paddles themselves are engineered with the right angle to cut through the water easily. Other kayakers in the group could not keep up with his stride and he was doing circles around them with such control. This was his first kayak and paddle of his own and he could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: good for a mixed bag of tricks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle and price! Somehow I hear water inside it after use, havent quite figured out where that water is because ill take the handle apart and tip ot but nothing comes out. That being said, it is a great paddle; i use it with my frenzy sit on top for a mixed bag of tricks - from hard paddle and play in surf to stealth mode when getting in close to eagles, herons, etc....i havent had it too terribly long but i do not see any rust or effects from salt water. we are getting another one
customer_reviews.author: Leslie D.

customer_reviews.title: I love using these
customer_reviews.text: I love using these. I didn't realize how long they are (I know that seems dumb since it's stated exactly how long they are), but I mean compared to my boyfriend's paddles that he bought at REI at the recommendation of an instructor (he bought the ones they use in the kayaking class), these are longer. I actually prefer them - it feels easier and smoother to use. I really like the soft grips so I don't get calluses on my hands. Would love to buy these again whenever my old gets get too banged up!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Weak paddle, only use for calm waters and light rowing. Get the protection plan if you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Second trip out on my kayak and the paddle bent 3/4 of the way up the rod rendering in unusable. I separated the pieces to try and get back to shore with the other side of the paddle and it snapped as well. I had to ride the waves to shore because I was stranded. Glad I got the protection plan on the paddle, if only it could have saved me the 1 1/2 mile walk back to grab my car and rescue my stranded kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Needham

customer_reviews.title: Don't love the thickness of the blade
customer_reviews.text: Don't love the thickness of the blade. It's a bit thin. I haven't broken it yet, but possibly because I'm gingerly paddling so I don't get stuck somewhere. It's affected my paddling because I am so worried about it. Otherwise, it's been nice. Foam padding is nice to have, and the rubber drip guards are helpful. Price is obviously great.
customer_reviews.author: Falcmanb

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: Best paddle I have bought for the money. Update: I have now owned 2 of these paddles over the past 2 years and both have broken fins. We do a lot of kayaking in shallow water and sometimes you need to push of the bottom, it appears the fins on these paddles do not handle pressure very well as they have broken when attempting this maneuver. I don't have this problem with other paddles I own such as the Carlisle Magic Mystic. Both get nearly identical uses, but the Carlisle has never broken.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Light weight is a big plus.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a kayaking expert, but I like this paddle for its light weight. My husband and I used the Shoreline paddle on several occasions, where I paddled happily for hours without any fatigue. I didn't appreciate the Shoreline paddle until I used one that was much heavier and had to stop paddling every couple of minutes because my arms hurt. The paddle is in two pieces that come apart easily, assemble easily, and stay assembled while paddling. You can adjust the angle of the blades. The foam handgrips are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: The paddles are good for the price. I only have a few complaints. The blades on one of the paddles I got were slightly off kilter. This wouldn't matter as much if you usually off set your blades for windy conditions, but if you like your blades even, you have to twist the shaft a little. Another thing is the blades get a little water in them that swishes around on a nice quiet paddle. It's trivial, I know, but I still notice it. The pluses are: extra long, seem well made, and sturdy. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: dummy

customer_reviews.title: Paddle on.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is light weight enough, and built quite well. It does not allow the angle feathering of its more costly brethren, nor is it made of carbon, but it does what it should sufficiently to make it to 5 stars. Honestly, it is better quality than expected. The drip rings are a bit loose, but again, it is still good enough. I would recommend it for trips of a weekend or less. Also, it could be a nice back up paddle if you are going on a long trip and taking a Werner Kalliste as a primary paddle.
customer_reviews.author: susie q

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Locking Mechanism
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism, which is the standard pop-through metal tab, seems less well constructed than other models I have looked at and it has already started to not function properly. When i put the two pieces together, the metal tab tends to get stuck in the down position and not lock into place. I have only owned the paddle for 2 months and only used it probably a dozen times. I have purchased a different paddle as a replacement. It is a shorter, one-piece aluminum shaft from Dick's Sporting Goods for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Super Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Broken Blade
customer_reviews.text: We don't know if the paddle blade arrived with a hairline fracture or if it broke during our first time out on the water. Unfortunately, we didn't notice until we got out on the water for a second time this season. The blade completely split apart becoming useless. No warranty information noted on Amazon. We are 7 days past our return window. Total time used 1.5 hours. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: jerseygirl

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Grip
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to attach together and stay sturdy. The grip is comfortable. They break down nicely and can be taken along with me on my stand up board so that I can have them with me if I switch to "kayaking" on my board instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage Don't Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is total garbage it snapped the 1st time I was using it and I was barely paddling through the water. Do not buy spend more money for a better paddle too bad I am out of the return window so now they are getting a review and everyone I talk to about kayaking will know to stay away from this company.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly for my son and myself with the sun dolphin kayaks that we also purchased on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to run the "Skull & Bones 500" you'll spend much more, but for us, this paddle works adequately for easy lagoon paddling. I gave 4 stars because the shaft diameter is a bit small for adult hands, and the pads slip, needing periodic re-positioning. Note: these blades are curved. On a long stroke, a curved blade is slightly more difficult to pull from the water once the blade is far rearward. This caused me to make shorter strokes: just an observation.
customer_reviews.author: DLR

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive paddle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one of our basic paddles that was lost. It's similar to the lost basic paddle in weight and balance, but the paddle surface is slightly shaped, and is a little nicer than the basic flat paddle. This is a great option for an inexpensive paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, snapped on 3rd use, not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Broke on 3rd kayak trip, snapped while on a float trip, not rough water. Would not buy another. Will be looking for refund.
customer_reviews.author: joshmo

customer_reviews.title: Its good, but not that good if you have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Long paddle for ocean, the rod does feel weak at times. There were a couple time I felt the rod want to bend. Its good, but not that good if you have to paddle hard.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: A little too long for some
customer_reviews.text: It was a little long to suit me. I didn't get to use it long enough to form a good opinion. I lost it in the Buffalo River in Arkansas going through a rough spot.
customer_reviews.author: D Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. Light weight and good design. They function well from start of stroke to end. The odd contour on the top of paddle seems to let it exit the water easily with very little drag. The three position adjustment is good but mine is slightly off when I set them to be on the same plane. They travel easy since they break down into two parts but they do collect a bit of water in them so make sure to drain them before they go in the back seat or trunk. Not sure you can beat them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ARTIFEX42

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many ShoreLine Products and have been happy with them. Purchased paddles before and still use them. The Propel series is very cheaply made. The tubing is half as thick as my previous Shoreline models. So then It bent and broke the first outing paddeling in the river.
customer_reviews.author: Richard b.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient with good build quality
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these, like it so much that I ordered a second. Now when my girlfriend or buddies want to go out we've got two paddles that we can break down and pack in our packs for a day trip. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't stay together.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Hobie kayak as back up if the mirage system didn't work. These paddles are pretty long. Probably would have been too long for me. (6') Then again I need paddled for maneuverability. That isn't the reason for the low score. The low score is because the material used is pretty cheap. The lock mechanism to keep these paddles together wasn't working right out of the box. Any slight twist would unlock them and any outward movement would see your paddle break in two. Needless to say I returned these and will just get a paddle elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Clev

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid paddle that does everything you'd expect it to do. The curvature of the paddles allows for more efficient movement than your standard flat paddle. It can be split in half to be used as a make shift canoe paddle if needed. I know this is a sin, but I use it on a 3-seater plastic canoe (wider than the standard canoe) and it reaches over perfectly. I had a manufacturing problem with my initial paddle and Shoreline Marine customer service took care of the problem incredibly well; they definitely stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: dead on arrival, rejuvenated
customer_reviews.text: the paddle arrived defective. i think i was lucky enough to repair it. that being said, a major engineering flaw was evident. the spring-loaded connector isn't mounted that well and there is only one (there should be two for added strength.) i may still need to return it, but i would have immediately if it weren't for the fact that my daughter wants to kayak tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Krohn

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for occasional kayaker
customer_reviews.text: Nice paddle, works great for someone that goes out once in a while. We read some of the reviews about not good quality but for the price decided to order it anyway. Glad we did! No it isn't top quality, but I can by 5 of these for 1 of their top quality ones. I think this one is going to hold up just fine though and is easy for me to use, lightweight. Don't regret the purchase at all and glad we didn't buy a "nicer" aka more expensive one just because it costs more.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey G

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good paddle, you can't beat it for the money. Don't think you can use it to push yourself off the bank or a gravel bar, it's not a push pole and the blade might break, it's a paddle. It's light and easy to handle. I have a fishing kayak and it's kind of wide so the paddle could be a bit longer for that application.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hager

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: great for the price. I finally broke both ends on mine after a year of use but only because I was grounded and instead of getting out of my boat I was trying to push myself along and ending up snapping both ends. not how your suppose to use them so its not the manufacturers fault. but I did upgrade to an aqua-bound paddle. which I could buy 5 of these for the price of that 1.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my inflatable kayak. They were easy to handle and efficient. I hadn't paddled in several years but these made it easy from the outset.
customer_reviews.author: Arlyn Maloy

customer_reviews.title: Only if you never take them apart
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the button that holds the two halves of the paddles together does not work well so you have to fiddle with them to get them to stay together. I can see this becoming an issue when you're getting ready to go out on the water and you can't get them to lock in the right position. I get that they're inexpensive but these were also cheap. They went back
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy paddle for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. Some scrapes after using it all summer to push me off some rocks and barnacles while kayaking. I love that it comes apart for storage, and I love that it stays in one piece while using it! It's quite comfortable to use, most water is kept off me with the adjustable stops, and I LOVE the padded comfort grip. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Island Girl

customer_reviews.title: Shoreline Kayak Paddle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this paddle as an addon for a combined deal with Riot Kayak. It arrive fast with free shipping, and upon opening it I was amazed by its light weight, and feature of being able to adjust angle of paddles. Also comes with drip stoppers. I would recommend this paddle as a starter paddle for anyone getting into kayaking. Only drawback would be it would be nice to have hook or lure retriever slot cut into paddle, but it wasn't really meant for a fishing accessory. So can't fault it for that or downgrade my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford S. Bombard

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: If this is the only paddle you own, stay on land.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Doolan

customer_reviews.title: Condition lie, or shipping problem?
customer_reviews.text: The female end of the paddle was crushed flat and bent at about 30 degrees. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these paddles to kayak the river. My husbands paddle snapped on our first trip so he only had one side half of the trip. These paddles may be ok if you are just going across a lake or something but if you are going to be kayaking around rocks etc they DO NOT hold up well
customer_reviews.author: Billy J. Croom

customer_reviews.title: My son is happy for mama is happy!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my son who is a kayak fanatic. :-) He fishes in one all the time on the Chattahoochee River. He loves these paddles and says they are so much nicer and easier to use than his one piece paddle. He's happy which makes his mama happy! :-) I would buy from this seller again too VERY fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Waitingformyshepherd

customer_reviews.title: Broken after one stroke
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! First stroke in the water and it bent right at the grip portion and was unusable. Refunded but I had to pay for packaging to get it back to the company. Also wasted my whole day out on the water! Thank goodness it didn’t break and leave me stranded in the water! Product seems very flimsy and wouldn’t try again
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P Barba

customer_reviews.title: Propel Kayak Paddle
customer_reviews.text: It is unfortunate that after purchasing this product I was finally able to use it last week. Unfortunately, it broke! I’ve missed my return window and I’m not able to find any way to contact anyone regarding this issue. This is a manufacture problem that needs to be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: christine stancliff

customer_reviews.title: Bent first time out
customer_reviews.text: The shaft bent the first time I used it. I should have read the recent reviews because the average is misleading. Apparently the paddle used to be good. Now it's probably only good for small kids or in very calm conditions and being careful not to try to paddle even a little bit hard.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a paddle that breaks
customer_reviews.text: These paddles broke on the first time I used them. POS
customer_reviews.author: lauren luck

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great pull
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed and lighter than our old paddles. The padding in the hand area was very nice for my older hands. The water gaskets were excellent for keeping me drier than I normally am. The shape was great and really helped as we paddled the Ohio.
customer_reviews.author: KnittedLauren

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: This paddle was the first paddle I owned and used for my Kayak. They are great beginner paddles. They hold up well, paddle well, and you can't beat the price. Eventually you will want one of the fiberglass or carbon paddles but you can't go wrong starting out with this paddle. I recommend this to anyone that is starting out or just needs a good recreational paddle.
customer_reviews.author: arrigob

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle!
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle! Really moves you through the water. Prior to this I was using the cheap paddle that came with my inflatable kayak. That thing was awful. I'm glad it broke and forced me to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight for the casual paddler
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight for the casual paddler. Looks sleek and feels sturdy. My only problem is the the pin that connects the two pieces gets stuck when you are locking them together. I had to tap it on a tree to get it to snap into place. It stays put once it is in place and seems like it would only be a problem if you separate the paddle frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea K S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I was hoping. Lightweight, easy to collapse and strong. I can't even say it's "good for the price". It's just plain good. The foam handles did start to slide around after they'd been wet for a while, like I read in other reviews, but that's easily managed and fixed. When other paddles are at least quadruple the price, I can deal with it. Even with slipping hand holds, I was able to use this paddle to propel my Prowler 13 the mile back to the dock ahead of my step fathers 10 ft boat with a 2.5 motor on the back of it. Out paddled a Motor! This thing is tough enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Works well i wouldnt pay more than $30
customer_reviews.text: Seems solid enough for the price, after doing a rapids and breaking the paddle I don't leave without a backup, it's got some weird bends in it, works good with my rouge river s110 10.4ft, but not with my explorer 10.4 but at the price point it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: ZJ DEADMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best paddles!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favourite paddles so far. I love the padded hand grips. The longer length of 96" is better for paddling.I bought used and was very happy with the savings.
customer_reviews.author: How did you contact the seller on the phone?

customer_reviews.title: Bought two paddles for our kayaks and they work great. I like how you can adjust the angle ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two paddles for our kayaks and they work great. I like how you can adjust the angle of the paddle to lessen the strain on your wrists, and the drip guards work great so you don't get soaked while paddling around. I also appreciate the foam over the handle part, which gives a nice soft grip.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: We love these paddles
customer_reviews.text: We love these paddles. They work very well for lake and open stream situations. For active paddling in fast (white) water, they might not be as durable as others, but I will never know. They are light and seem to have better thrust characteristics than other paddles I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used tandem kayak and needed a couple of affordable paddles. After shopping around town, I found some cheap ones that were to short for me for $50. The ones I liked that fit me were $100 a piece. I went on Amazon.com and found these for $36 a piece (if I remember correctly... somewhere around there). Shipping is free with my Prime, so life is good! Noce and sturdy paddles, great item for the money, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Finn Markmanrud

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I like them enough to replace my first set after a house fire
customer_reviews.author: Jerri B.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Chinese junk ever
customer_reviews.text: This quite possibly could be the worst piece of equipment we have purchased. We did 1 m this quite possibly could be the worst piece of equipment we have purchased. We had our maiden Voyage on our new sea kayak only to have the first break within minutes. We went out again thinking it was just a fluke only to have a second break immediately there after. No heavy paddling. Normal paddling. Stay away from this product. It is awful.
customer_reviews.author: April Morin

customer_reviews.title: It has a pretty wide opening to sit in
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman of 5'4" and my canoe is a Dagger Zydeco, 11.0. It has a pretty wide opening to sit in, so the length of these paddles work very well on a still lake or a wide river. They are a bit long for a narrow river, that moves swiftly and has many obstacles to be avoided. The added length allows my husband to also use them comfortably (he's 6'). I find them to be very comfortable with the foam grips, and I consider them light-weight enough to kayak for hours. For the price, I consider it a great paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: it worked fine. One annoyance is there are little plastic seals ...
customer_reviews.text: Taken them for one trip, it worked fine. One annoyance is there are little plastic seals inside each half to keep water out and I guess to keep them full of air so they float. Good idea except that some water will get into the paddle at the blade connection and it is a royal pain to get out. Yes aluminum is corrosion resistant compared to steel, but water sloshing around inside the paddle is irritating and if it is sea water will start to corrode aluminum too. I will likely pull the seals out once I figure out how so they can drain and replace them after I have sealed the blade to the tube better.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, fittings stay tight.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this paddle for a few months and I really like how solid it is and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Nice paddle that is light weight. Good hand grips and multiple adjustments. Strong enough to use for push offs but it is plastic so keep that in mind. Really happy with this paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Silver

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: These are nice light weight paddles and my wife prefers them over the Carlisle paddles we also have. I have three of this model the oldest being over 2 years old. There not as solid as the Carlisle paddles so I doubt they will last as long but so far so good. Keep in mind that at 96" in length these are best suited for SOT kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: cruz878

customer_reviews.title: It broke
customer_reviews.text: I would like to think I am really strong, but I know a lot of stronger guys. First time out with the paddle, I tried to paddle a bit hard and the aluminum collapsed, folded, then broke in two. I was able to widdle a stick to the right size and shove both broken ends over it, then run some duct tape around it to salvage the trip, but it was a bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Zastoupil

product_meta.title: Shoreline Marine 96-Inch Rounded Kayak Paddle
product_meta.description: The Shoreline Marine Rounded Blade Kayak Paddle adjusts easily to three different positions allowing you to fine-tune the entry angle of you your paddle to match your rowing style and provide great control in all the conditions you will encounter out on the water. The foam shaft grips add comfort and control to the lightweight aluminum shaft while the drip guards keep your hands dry for a comfortable day out on the water. The rounded blades provide a great push through the water without wearing out your arms. A strong performer designed for kayakers of all skill levels.
feature_bullets: The simple and comfortable design of our Kayaking Paddle will keep you moving on the water all day
With foam grips for added comfort, and double drip guards to help keep you dry, the design will keep you paddling all day!
Three position pin system allows you to rotate the aluminum shaft to customize the paddle blade angle to fit your style and experience level maximizing comfort and the power of your paddle stroke
Constructed with a corrosion resistant aluminum shaft which disassembles into two pieces to make transportation and storage a breeze.
The contour molded blade propels you through the water with ease
Get out on the water today
Drip Guards To Help Keep You Dry
Three position system allows you to customize the paddle to fit your style
Disassembles into two pieces to make transportation a breeze
The contour molded blade propels you through the water with ease

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
